intro: Hieracium bradinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium bradinum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and light conditions.
